snippet: The election, which was deeply disputed, was a display of the loyalty of President Bashar al-Assad’s supporters and the failures of his opposition and its backers.
abstract: Pres Bashar al-Assad of Syria celebrates his overwhelming victory in a deeply disputed election, asserting his confidence and defiance in the Syrian conflict as supporters savor his success in thwarting the United States; officials announce that he was re-elected with 88.7 percent of the vote and report a turnout of 73.4 percent of eligible voters.

byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: The election, which was deeply disputed, was a display of the loyalty of President Bashar al-Assad’s supporters and the failures of his opposition and its backers.

headline.main: Victory in Syrian Election Is Show of Assad’s Control
headline.print_headline: Victory in Syrian Election Is Show of Assad’s Control

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
